description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kqnf","text":"This is a protocol to infect and maintain Daphnia with Pasteuria ramosa for use in laboratory experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":55,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
document: {"blocks":[{"key":"98puf","text":"Pasteuria farm protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19io1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4phin","text":"Written by Katherine Hunsberger","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vbe4","text":"Additions made by Rebecca Bilich on 3/2/2021","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gcn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11ttc","text":"Set up: start a farm with ~75 Mid 37 animals (young animals, if possible) and a dose of 2000 sp/mL of Pasteuria G/18 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ef22r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b69m2","text":"Use a 1000 mL Erlenmeyer flask and add Daphnia from a beaker of 75 by running them down the side of the flask, then rinsing the inner sides of the beaker and flask to dislodge any stuck animals. Small juveniles 0-2 days old are the most likely to be infected although adding variety of ages will help the farm last longer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5elt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a50o5","text":"Add water to bring the final volume of the farm up to 900mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8uab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d8br","text":"Select Mid 37s already infected with Pasteuria G-18 to create the spore slurry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3muvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp7kr","text":"Estimate the number of animals needed by supposing that each infected animal contains 60,000 Pasteuria spores.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7perp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en7bc","text":"Grind the animals up in microcentrifuge tubes using an electric pestle from 60 seconds, making sure to make a homogenous mixture with no obvious Daphnia parts. Then remove the slurry to a small (5 mL) beaker. Then rinse each tube with about 0.5 mL of filtered lake water, vortex the tubes for a few seconds, and add this water to the slurry as well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6si8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajc5a","text":"Mix the slurry well with a pipet for 60 seconds and then add 10 mL to four wells in a Neubauer Hemocytometer. Do 4 cell counts, excluding spores that do not appear viable (degraded or immature spores.) If the grid is very dense, you can estimate by counting the 5 diagonal squares and multiplying the total by 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8ckm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flrbb","text":"Choose 3 or more counts that are within 85% of each other, take the average of this number, and multiply it by 10,000 to get the concentration of the slurry in spores/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pdn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebvki","text":"Use the equation M1*V1=M2*V2 to find the volume of slurry to add to each farm. Add this amount with a pipet and then feed each farm only 10 mL of food (after adding the spores, to mix them around.) Tap the flask with a small amount of cetyl alcohol. Also feed only 10 mL on the next feeding day to encourage Daphnia to consume pasteuria spores. On subsequent feeding days feed 20 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ao03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27klf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u472","text":"Maintenance: check farms for first time after ~30 days; then check every 7-10 days","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34no","text":"Follow similar rules as Metsch farm maintenance for adding more animals and/or spores or taking down the farms ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dgne","text":"If  you start checking a farm and the animals look pretty lightly infected, I would hold off another week or so before checking them to let the spores grow up","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u1f2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"860md","text":"Storage: store in freezer indefinitely, but ramp up for experimental needs as far in advance as possible","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Duffy Lab, EEB, University of Michigan

status.info: We use this document and it’s working

title: Pasteuria farm protocol
